bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, January 28, 1880

div1.p: Reed forwards mail to McPherson. Reed contemplates having his wife and son return west.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, January 28, 1880
div1.p:
The latest news from
you is a telegram from Gatewood
stating that you are all ordered
to Thomas, to stay indefinitely, and re-
-questing to have all mail forwar-
-ded there- I accordingly forward by
this mail all your letters, your girl's
and others- Also an envelope contain-
-ing a photo- of your girl, I expect;
and I'll be “dag-gane” if I was ever
so tempted to do anything as I am
to open that envelope & get a “peep”
at her- I know she must be just
gorgeous! I'll have to wait though
till you come back before my
curiosity can be satisfied- I wrote
you a letter which I thought would
reach you at Bowie- You perceive
by that I have some thought of
having my wife & baby come
back- Please let me hear from
you on the subject matter of
that letter, if you ever get it-
write me, by return mail, &
state whether you have got it
or not- I am very sorry that
you have to “sit down acou” at
old Camp Thomas! Apache is
too monotonous for even the ravens!
It is simply fearful! But I have
become much more studious than
when you left- Stay in my room
all day & read- Had Don't go to
the Sutters more than once in a
week- “Do thou likewise”, my boy-
I have a package for you, sent
by Mrs. Coon,- Think it contains a
few few fancy articles of dress-
won't send it, as I know you won't
need them- Give my best love to that
famous pie-devourer, Tommy Cruise,
& tell him that “Joe” has deserted me &
taken up his abode with the company-
kindest regards to Lts. Gatewood &
Mills- It is snowing like “wild-fire”-
about 6 inches fallen since morning-
Study hard, my boy, & come back soon
to Apache- “Be virtuous”-
div1.closer:
Ever your all
sincere friend Bolus T. Reed.
